alert.note: Alert for Butler (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 12:54AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Logan, western Butler and southern Ohio Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Livermore to 11 miles southeast of Crofton. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Russellville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
